fullText: Mr. Schreiber and Mr. Hoffman bring a beautiful sense of specificity to their roles, creating characters who feel like real people rather than theatrical types.
dtliExcerpt: Mr. Schreiber and Mr. Hoffman bring a beautiful sense of specificity to their roles, creating characters who feel like real people rather than theatrical types.
bwwExcerpt: But such scenes here lack the precision timing that would make them seriously funny. And the sight-gag scenery they require - to evoke a low-budget theater's representation of a lifeboat at sea or the barricades of the French revolution - adds extra bulk to what is already ponderous.
showScoreExcerpt: Mr. Schreiber and Mr. Hoffman bring a beautiful sense of specificity to their roles, creating characters who feel like real people rather than theatrical types.
